**INSTITUTION
ORTHOPEDIC SURGERY
DISCHARGE SUMMARY
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT # :
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[YYY M ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Oct 30 2007]
DISCHARGE DATE :
**DATE[Nov 03 2007]
ADMISSION DIAGNOSIS :
L5-S1 isthmic spondylolisthesis and chronic back pain .
DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS :
L5-S1 isthmic spondylolisthesis and chronic back pain status post L5-S1 decompressive laminectomy , posterior lumbar interbody fusion , posterior spinal instrumental fusion , and L5-S1 iliac crest bone graft .
INDICATIONS FOR PROCEDURE :
The patient is a **AGE[in 30s]- year - old gentleman with longstanding history of back pain , radiculopathy in his buttocks , and noted isthmic spondylolisthesis .
He had fair preoperative workup and discussed the risks and benefits of surgery with Dr. **NAME[ZZZ] including but not limited to bleeding , infection , neural trauma , possible chronic pain , possible recurrence of symptoms , junctional stenosis , and possible chronic numbness , weakness , or pain .
He understood these concerns and opted for operative treatment .
The patient was admitted on **DATE[Oct 30 2007] , and underwent L5-S1 decompressive laminectomy , posterior spinal fusion , and posterior lumbar interbody fusion with iliac crest bone graft .
The procedure was tolerated without complication .
Postoperatively he was doing well .
He was transferred to the floor .
He did have a high pain medication regimen preoperatively and he was restarted back on his baseline OxyContin levels .
He was relatively comfortable with this as well as oxycodone for breakthrough pain .
He was otherwise tolerating a regular diet .
He was ambulating with physical therapy .
He did require a wheeled walker , but was doing well and was stable to get to and from the bathroom up and down the hallway without significant help .
He was otherwise stable for discharge to home .
**INSTITUTION .
DISCHARGE INSTRUCTIONS :
Follow up with Dr. **NAME[ZZZ] in 2 to 3 weeks .
Call for an appointment at **PHONE .
Please call sooner or immediately if he should develop fevers , chills , redness , warmth , or discharge from the incision .
Please wear an abdominal binder when out of bed and ambulating .
He can wear it to go to and from the bathroom and __________ wear while sleeping .
Keep the incision clean , dry , and covered , replace with dry sterile gauze daily .
Do not soak the incision .
He may begin to shower in 2 days covering the incision with saran wrap and then pat dry after the shower .
DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS :
1. OxyContin 60 mg p.o. b.i.d.
2. Oxycodone 5 mg 1 to 3 tablets p.o. q.4 hours p.r.n. breakthrough pain .
3. Lyrica 75 mg p.o. b.i.d.
4. Metformin 500 mg p.o. b.i.d.
5. Amaryl 4 mg p.o. daily .
6. TriCor 145 p.o. daily .
7. Elavil 100 mg p.o. daily .
8. Reglan 10 mg 3 times a day with meals .
9. Colace 100 mg p.o. b.i.d.
